calculate_mass_fractionation_factor¶

isopy.tb.calculate_mass_fractionation_factor(data, ratio, std_abu=None, std_mass=None)[source]¶

Calculate the mass fractionation factor for a given ratio in data.

\[\alpha = \ln{( \frac{r_{n,d}}{R_{n,d}} )} * \frac{1}{ \ln{( m_{n,d} } )}\]

where \(n\) is the numerator isotope and \(d\) is the denominator isotope.

Parameters

  • data (RatioArray) – Fractionated data. \(r\) in the equation above.

  • ratio (RatioString) – The isotope ratio from which the fractionation factor should be calculated. \(n,d\) in the equation above.

  • std_abu (RatioArray, dict, optional) – An object with a “.get(item, default_value)” method containing the abundance of each isotope/ratio needed for this function. Default is the “best isotope fraction” reference values. \(R\) in the equation above.

  • std_mass (RatioArray, dict, optional) – An object with a “.get(item, default_value)” method containing the masses of each isotope/ratio needed for this function. Default is the “isotope mass” reference values. \(m\) in the equation above.

Returns

The fractionation factor for ratio in data. \(\alpha\) in the equation above.

Return type

float
